finalproject

Class Graph

  • java.lang.Object
    • finalproject.Graph

  • public class Graph
extends java.lang.Object
    Graph is a class that handles information about all the cities in one simulation. A Graph object stores a list of existing cities in one simulation, updates paths between cities, and finds consecutive paths from distribution cities to destination cities.

    • Method Detail

      • addCity

        public void addCity(City city)
        Adds a City object to the list of cities in Graph. Any City object can be added to this list, regardless of being a distribution center or not.
        Parameters:
        city - -> the city to be added to the list

      • getCities

        public java.util.ArrayList<City> getCities()

      • addEdge

        public boolean addEdge(City a,
                       City b,
                       int distance)
        Adds a route from City A to City B, noting the distance between the two. City B becomes a key in City A's cityConnections, where the distance is the corresponding value, and vice versa.
        Parameters:
        a - -> the first city
        b - -> the second city
        distance - -> the distance between the two cities
        Returns:
        true is edge added successfully, false otherwise.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • getBestDistributionCenter

        public City getBestDistributionCenter(City start)
        Determines best distribution center to ship from to city "start".
        Parameters:
        start - -> The customer's location
        Returns:
        -> The cheapest distribution center to ship from.

      • getShortestRouteCost

        public double getShortestRouteCost(City start)
        Computes shipping cost based on customer's location and best distribution center for that customer.
        Parameters:
        start - -> The customer's location
        Returns:
        -> Total distance of optimal shipping route / 100 to use fixed cost of $0.01 per km.

      • getShortestRoute

        public java.util.ArrayList<City> getShortestRoute(City start)
        Find the shortest shipping route in graph to start location.
        Parameters:
        start - -> The customer's location.
        Returns:
        An array list of cities completing the most cost efficient path from the best distribution center for the shopper, and ending at the shopper's city. Null if no path is possible.

      • cityFromString

        public City cityFromString(java.lang.String cityName)
        Parameters:
        cityName -
        Returns:
        City object with name cityName if it exists, otherwise return null.

      • getNonDistCenters

        public java.util.ArrayList<City> getNonDistCenters()
        Returns:
        ArrayList of cities that do not have distribution centers.

      • getDistributionCenters

        public java.util.ArrayList<City> getDistributionCenters()
        Returns:
        ArrayList of cities that do have distribution centers.
